what: Interface to JDemetra+ 3.x time series analysis software.
title: Interface to JDemetra+ 3.x time series analysis software.
text: rjd3workspace offers several functions wrangle JDemetra+ v3.x workspaces. Seasonal adjustment X-12ARIMA can done package rjd3x13 TRAMO-SEATS package rjd3tramoseats.

title: Interface to JDemetra+ 3.x time series analysis software.
text: rjd3workspace relies rJava package Running rjd3 packages requires Java 17 higher. set configuration R explained

title: Interface to JDemetra+ 3.x time series analysis software.
text: get current stable version (latest release): GitHub: r-universe:

title: Interface to JDemetra+ 3.x time series analysis software.
text: can install development version rjd3workspace GitHub :

title: Interface to JDemetra+ 3.x time series analysis software.
code: library("rjd3workspace")  dir <- tempdir()  y <- rjd3toolkit::ABS$X0.2.09.10.M jws <- .jws_new() jsap1 <- .jws_sap_new(jws, "sa1") add_sa_item(jsap1, name = "x13", x = rjd3x13::x13(y)) add_sa_item(jsap1, name = "tramo", x = rjd3tramoseats::tramoseats(y)) save_workspace(jws, file.path(dir, "ws.xml"))  jws <- .jws_load(file = file.path(dir, "ws.xml")) .jws_compute(jws) # to compute the models jsap1 <- .jws_sap(jws, idx = 1) # first SAProcessing jsa1 <- .jsap_sa(jsap1, idx = 1) # first SAItem .jsa_name(jsa1) #> [1] "x13" mod1 <- .jsa_read(jsa1)

title: Interface to JDemetra+ 3.x time series analysis software.
code: # install.packages("remotes") # remotes::install_github("rjdverse/rjd3providers")  dir <- tempdir()  xlsx_file <- paste0(system.file("examples", package="rjd3providers"), "/Insee.xlsx") ts1 <- rjd3providers::spreadsheet_series(file = xlsx_file, sheet = 1L, series = 3L)  y <- ts1$data jws <- .jws_new() jsap1 <- .jws_sap_new(jws, "sa1") add_sa_item(jsap1, name = "x13", x = rjd3x13::x13(y)) rjd3workspace::set_ts(jsap = jsap1, idx = 1L, y = ts1) add_sa_item(jsap1, name = "tramo", x = rjd3tramoseats::tramoseats(y)) rjd3workspace::set_ts(jsap = jsap1, idx = 2L, y = ts1)  save_workspace(jws, file.path(dir, "ws.xml"))  jws <- .jws_load(file = file.path(dir, "ws.xml")) .jws_compute(jws) # to compute the models jsap1 <- .jws_sap(jws, idx = 1) # first SAProcessing jsa1 <- .jsap_sa(jsap1, idx = 1) # first SAItem .jsa_name(jsa1) #> [1] "x13" mod1 <- .jsa_read(jsa1)

title: Add Calendar to Workspace — add_calendar

title: Add SAItem to SAProcessing — add_sa_item
text: jsap SAProcessing. name name SAItem. x either seasonal adjustment model (rjd3x13::x13() rjd3tramoseats::tramoseats()), SaItem "ts" object. spec specification use x "ts" object. ... unused parameters.

title: Add SAItem to SAProcessing — add_sa_item
code: dir <- tempdir() y <- rjd3toolkit::ABS$X0.2.09.10.M jws <- .jws_new() jsap1 <- .jws_sap_new(jws, "sa1") add_sa_item(jsap1, name = "x13", x = rjd3x13::x13(y)) add_sa_item(jsap1, name = "tramo", x = rjd3tramoseats::tramoseats(y)) add_sa_item(jsap1, name = "x13-2", x = y, rjd3x13::x13_spec()) add_sa_item(jsap1, name = "tramo-2", x = y, rjd3tramoseats::tramoseats_spec()) save_workspace(jws, file.path(dir, "workspace.xml"))

title: Add Variable to Workspace — add_variable
text: jws workspace object. group, name group name variable add. y variable (ts object).

title: Extract Java Metadata — .jsa_metadata
text: Extract specific metadata time series metadata SAItem.

title: Extract Java Metadata — .jsa_metadata
text: jsa Java SAItem object. key key metadata.

title: Read SAItem — .jsa_read
text: .jsa_results() extracts specific variables model SAItem .jsa_read() extracts informations SAItem (see details).

title: Read SAItem — .jsa_read
text: jsa Java SAItem object. items vector characters containing variables extract. See rjd3x13::x13_dictionary() rjd3tramoseats::tramoseats_dictionary(). default, extracts possible variables.

title: Read SAItem — .jsa_read
text: SAItem contains information just results model. informations extracted .jsa_read() function returns list 5 objects: ts: raw time series. domainSpec: initial specification. Reference relaxing elements specification. estimationSpec: specification used current estimation. pointSpec: specification corresponding results current estimation (fully identified model). results: result model.

title: Get the name of a SAProcessing or a SaItem — .jsap_name
Get the name of a SAProcessing or a SaItem — .jsap_name
code: # \donttest{  y <- rjd3toolkit::ABS$X0.2.09.10.M  jws <- .jws_new() jsap1 <- .jws_sap_new(jws, "sa1")  add_sa_item(jsap1, name = "x13", x = rjd3x13::x13(y)) add_sa_item(jsap1, name = "tramo", x = rjd3tramoseats::tramoseats(y)) add_sa_item(jsap1, name = "x13-2", x = y, rjd3x13::x13_spec()) add_sa_item(jsap1, name = "tramo-2", x = y, rjd3tramoseats::tramoseats_spec())  print(.jsap_sa_name(jsap1)) #> [1] "x13"     "tramo"   "x13-2"   "tramo-2" # }

title: Read all SaItems — read_workspace
code: file<-system.file("workspaces", "test.xml", package = "rjd3workspace") jws<-.jws_load(file) # We don't compute the workspace rws<-read_workspace(jws, FALSE)

title: Refresh Workspace or SAProcessing — refresh
code: .jsap_refresh(   jsap,   policy = c("FreeParameters", "Complete", "Outliers_StochasticComponent", "Outliers",     "FixedParameters", "FixedAutoRegressiveParameters", "Fixed"),   period = 0,   start = NULL,   end = NULL,   info = c("All", "Data", "None") )  .jws_refresh(   jws,   policy = c("FreeParameters", "Complete", "Outliers_StochasticComponent", "Outliers",     "FixedParameters", "FixedAutoRegressiveParameters", "Fixed"),   period = 0,   start = NULL,   end = NULL,   info = c("All", "Data", "None") )

title: Refresh Workspace or SAProcessing — refresh
text: policy refresh policy apply (see details). period, start, end specify span outliers re-identified (.e.: re-detected) policy = "Outliers" policy = "Outliers_StochasticComponent". Span definition: period: numeric, number observations year (12, 4...). start end: first last date outliers re-identfied, defined arrays two elements: year first period (example, period = 12, c(1980, 1) January 1980). specified, outliers re-identified whole series. info information refresh. jws, jsap Java Workspace Multiprocessing

title: Refresh Workspace or SAProcessing — refresh
text: Available refresh policies : Current: applying current pre-adjustment reg-arima model adding new raw data points Additive Outliers (defined new intervention variables) Fixed: applying current pre-adjustment reg-arima model replacing forecasts new raw data points. FixedParameters: pre-adjustment reg-arima model partially modified: regression coefficients re-estimated regression variables, Arima orders coefficients unchanged. FixedAutoRegressiveParameters: FixedParameters Arima Moving Average coefficients (MA) also re-estimated, Auto-regressive (AR) coefficients kept fixed. FreeParameters: regression Arima model coefficients re-estimated, regression variables Arima orders kept fixed. Outliers: regression variables Arima orders kept fixed, outliers re-detected defined span, thus regression Arima model coefficients re-estimated Outliers_StochasticComponent: "Outliers" Arima model orders (p,d,q)(P,D,Q) can also re-identified.

title: Save Workspace — save_workspace
code: dir <- tempdir() jws <- .jws_new() jsap1 <- .jws_sap_new(jws, "sa1") y <- rjd3toolkit::ABS$X0.2.09.10.M add_sa_item(jsap1, name = "x13", x = y, rjd3x13::x13_spec()) save_workspace(jws, file.path(dir, "workspace.xml"))

what: Set Time Series Metadata of a SaItem — set_ts_metadata
title: Set Time Series Metadata of a SaItem — set_ts_metadata
text: Function set time series metadata SaItem (provider, source data...). set_ts_metadata() uses metadata another SaItem put_ts_metadata() allows update specific key new information.

title: Set Time Series Metadata of a SaItem — set_ts_metadata
code: set_ts_metadata(jsap, idx, ref_jsa)  put_ts_metadata(jsap, idx, key, value)

title: Set Time Series Metadata of a SaItem — set_ts_metadata
text: jsap SAProcessing modify. idx index target SaItem. ref_jsa reference SaItem containing metadata. key key metadata. value value metadata.

title: Set Time Series Metadata of a SaItem — set_ts_metadata
code: # Change the file of a given item file <- system.file("workspaces", "test.xml", package = "rjd3workspace") jws <- .jws_load(file) jsap <- .jws_sap(jws, 1) jsa <- .jsap_sa(jsap, 1) nid <- rjd3providers::spreadsheet_change_file(.jsa_ts_metadata(jsa, "@id"), "test.xlsx") put_ts_metadata(jsap, 1, "@id", nid) jsa <- .jsap_sa(jsap, 1) .jsa_ts_metadata(jsa, "@id") #> [1] "demetra://tsprovider/XCLPRVDR/20111201/SERIES?file=test.xlsx#seriesName=European+Union&sheetName=Exports"
